instruction: Describe the differences between Shakespearean and modern English.
output: Shakespearean English is the form of Early Modern English used by William Shakespeare in his plays and poetry. It is characterized by complex sentence structures and archaic words. Modern English is the form of English used by contemporary speakers, which includes simplified sentence structures, shorter words, and different pronunciation. Shakespearean English also has much more use of metaphor and imagery, while Modern English has more direct syntax.
